annotation.spannedText: Most people who get chickenpox vaccine will not get chickenpox

classMention.mentionClass: Most people who get chickenpox vaccine will not get chickenpox

annotation.spannedText: if someone who has been vaccinated does get chickenpox, it is usually very mild

classMention.mentionClass: if someone who has been vaccinated does get chickenpox, it is usually very mild

annotation.spannedText: Children who have never had chickenpox should get 2 doses of chickenpox vaccine at these ages

classMention.mentionClass: Children who have never had chickenpox should get 2 doses of chickenpox vaccine at these ages

annotation.spannedText: People 13 years of age and older (who have never had chickenpox or received chickenpox vaccine) should get two doses at least 28 days apart

classMention.mentionClass: People 13 years of age and older (who have never had chickenpox or received chickenpox vaccine) should get two doses at least 28 days apart

annotation.spannedText: Anyone who is not fully vaccinated, and never had chickenpox, should receive one or two doses of chickenpox vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Anyone who is not fully vaccinated, and never had chickenpox, should receive one or two doses of chickenpox vaccine

annotation.spannedText: People should not get chickenpox vaccine if they have ever had a life-threatening allergic reaction to a previous dose of chickenpox vaccine or to gelatin or the antibiotic neomycin

classMention.mentionClass: People should not get chickenpox vaccine if they have ever had a life-threatening allergic reaction to a previous dose of chickenpox vaccine or to gelatin or the antibiotic neomycin

annotation.spannedText: People who are moderately or severely ill at the time the shot is scheduled should usually wait until they recover before getting chickenpox vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: People who are moderately or severely ill at the time the shot is scheduled should usually wait until they recover before getting chickenpox vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Pregnant women should wait to get chickenpox vaccine until after they have given birth

classMention.mentionClass: Pregnant women should wait to get chickenpox vaccine until after they have given birth

annotation.spannedText: Women should not get pregnant for 1 month after getting chickenpox vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Women should not get pregnant for 1 month after getting chickenpox vaccine

annotation.spannedText: People who recently had a transfusion or were given other blood products should ask their doctor when they may get chickenpox vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: People who recently had a transfusion or were given other blood products should ask their doctor when they may get chickenpox vaccine

annotation.spannedText: A vaccine, like any medicine, is capable of causing serious problems, such as severe allergic reactions

classMention.mentionClass: A vaccine, like any medicine, is capable of causing serious problems, such as severe allergic reactions

annotation.spannedText: The risk of chickenpox vaccine causing serious harm, or death, is extremely small

classMention.mentionClass: The risk of chickenpox vaccine causing serious harm, or death, is extremely small

annotation.spannedText: Getting chickenpox vaccine is much safer than getting chickenpox disease

classMention.mentionClass: Getting chickenpox vaccine is much safer than getting chickenpox disease

annotation.spannedText: the reaction should be reported to the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS)

classMention.mentionClass: the reaction should be reported to the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS)
